node.title: ‘A War Hero and Patriot’: Leaders React to the Death of Bob Dole
node.alt: Bob Dole announcing his resignation from the U.S. Senate in 1996, when he was the Republican nominee for president. He died on Sunday at 98.
node.description: Former presidents and political leaders recalled Mr. Dole’s dignity, sense of humor and lifetime commitment to public service.
node.content: ["Leaders from across the political spectrum offered tributes to Bob Dole, the former Senate majority leader and Republican presidential nominee who died on Sunday, hailing him as a war hero and statesman who dedicated his life to public service.", "\u201cBob Dole was a man to be admired by Americans,\u201d President Biden said on Twitter. \u201cHe had an unerring sense of integrity and honor.\u201d", "The president cited Mr. Dole\u2019s \u201clegacy of decency, dignity, good humor, and patriotism.\u201d", "Vice President Kamala Harris called Mr. Dole \u201ca war hero and patriot.\u201d", "Senator Mitch McConnell, the Kentucky Republican and minority leader, said in a statement that Mr. Dole\u2019s \u201clifetime of service was rooted in a simple mission: looking out for his neighbors.\u201d", "That path started with serving customers at a soda fountain in Russell, Kan., and continued through his service in the Army\u2019s 10th Mountain Division during World War II, and it was capped off by nearly 30 years in the Senate and more than a decade as the Republican leader, he said.", "\u201cHis Dust Bowl roots fueled a special commitment to vulnerable Americans, and sure enough, Bob\u2019s work on food security, veterans\u2019 issues, and the rights of disabled Americans have continued to have an especially lasting impact,\u201d Mr. McConnell said.", "Mike Pence, the former Republican vice president in the Trump administration, said Mr. Dole \u201clived an extraordinary life of service to America.\u201d", "Former President Barack Obama said on Twitter that Mr. Dole\u2019s political leadership and demeanor harked \u201cback to a day when members of the Greatest Generation abided by a certain code, putting country over party.\u201d", "Former President George W. Bush said of Mr. Dole in a statement: \u201cThis good man represented the finest of American values.\u201d", "\u201cI will always remember Bob\u2019s salute to my late dad at the Capitol,\u201d Mr. Bush added, referring to his father, former President George H.W. Bush, who died in 2018, \u201cand now we Bushes salute Bob and give thanks for his life of principled service.\u201d", "Former President Bill Clinton, Mr. Dole\u2019s opponent in the 1996 presidential contest, said on Twitter that Mr. Dole dedicated his life to serving the American people, \u201cfrom his heroism in World War II to the 35 years he spent in Congress.\u201d", "\u201cAfter all he gave in the war,\u201d Mr. Clinton added, \u201che didn\u2019t have to give more. But he did. His example should inspire people today and for generations to come.\u201d", "Al Franken, the Democratic former U.S. senator and comedy writer, said of Mr. Dole: \u201cHe was a war hero, one of the great senators, a lovely man, and \u2026 well, I\u2019m finally the funniest former US senator. I\u2019ll miss this REALLY funny man.\u201d"]
